_template_info.description: Configuration for the Nimble Earth imprint
_template_info.usage: Configuration for imprint specializing in climate science.

publisher_persona.persona_bio: Former IPCC contributing author and data scientist with 15 years at the intersection of climate modeling and public communication. Passionate about making complex science accessible without sacrificing rigor.
publisher_persona.preferred_topics: Climate feedback loops, carbon cycle modeling, policy impact analysis, and socio-economic adaptation strategies.
publisher_persona.target_demographics: Graduate students, policy advisors, science journalists, and corporate sustainability officers.
publisher_persona.vulnerabilities: Potential over-reliance on the 'grounded LLM' narrative; requires constant validation to avoid being perceived as a gimmick. Blind spot for purely activist or narrative-driven climate writing that lacks a strong data foundation.

wizard_configuration.name: Nimble Earth
wizard_configuration.charter: To foster perspective diversity in climate science with a rigorous, non-negotiable respect for ground truth, leveraging innovative AI to make complex data accessible and actionable.

publishing_focus.target_audience: Academics, Policymakers, and Informed General Readers
publishing_focus.specialization: Synthesizing complex climate data (AR7) with diverse human perspectives using grounded AI methodologies.

codextypes.description: Specialized content types requiring custom interior design and formatting to ensure source transparency and scholarly utility.

specialized_requirements.interior_design_notes: A multi-column grid is essential. A main column for primary text, with a dedicated secondary column or styled sidebars for LLM-generated summaries, critiques, or syntheses. This prevents LLM content from being mistaken for the authorial voice. The layout must elegantly integrate complex data visualizations (charts, graphs, maps) without breaking the flow of reading.
specialized_requirements.template_customizations: Requires a system of marginalia or icons to flag every LLM-generated statement with its specific grounding source within AR7. This could be a precise page/figure reference system that is visually distinct from traditional academic citations. A glossary of terms is also recommended.
specialized_requirements.typesetting_considerations: A robust typographic hierarchy is critical. A serif font (Minion Pro) for the main body text (human author), a distinct sans-serif (Gill Sans) for interview/oral history segments, and a third monospaced font (Source Code Pro), possibly with a color tint, for all LLM-generated text blocks. This visual coding is non-negotiable for maintaining intellectual honesty and transparency about content origin.

textbook.name: Textbook
textbook.description: Structured for educational use with clear sections, data visualizations, and pedagogical elements.

reference.name: Reference Work
reference.description: Designed for non-linear reading and quick information retrieval, with heavy cross-referencing.

oral_history.name: Oral History / Interview
oral_history.description: Formatted for interview-style content with clear speaker identification.

design_parameters.primary_considerations: Clarity of Attribution and Source Transparency. The central design challenge is to create a visual system that allows the reader to instantly differentiate between the primary author's analysis, quoted perspectives from individuals, raw data from AR7, and LLM-generated content.
design_parameters.interior_layout_notes: A multi-column grid is essential. A main column for primary text, with a dedicated secondary column or styled sidebars for LLM-generated summaries, critiques, or syntheses. This prevents LLM content from being mistaken for the authorial voice. The layout must elegantly integrate complex data visualizations (charts, graphs, maps) without breaking the flow of reading.
design_parameters.typesetting_requirements: A robust typographic hierarchy is critical. A serif font for the main body text (human author), a distinct sans-serif for interview/oral history segments, and a third, possibly monospaced or color-tinted, font for all LLM-generated text blocks. This visual coding is non-negotiable for maintaining intellectual honesty and transparency about content origin.
design_parameters.functional_elements: A rigorous and multi-layered citation system. Beyond a standard index and bibliography, the design needs a system of marginalia or icons to flag every LLM-generated statement with its specific grounding source within AR7. This could be a precise page/figure reference system that is visually distinct from traditional academic citations. A glossary of terms is also recommended.
design_parameters.reader_interaction_model: The book will be used for analytical and comparative reading, not linear consumption. Readers will actively cross-reference the main arguments against the LLM syntheses and the source data. The design must facilitate this non-linear navigation, allowing a reader to easily move between a claim, its source, and a contrasting perspective.

llm_analysis.reasoning: The imprint's mission to blend diverse human perspectives with LLM-generated analysis, all grounded in dense scientific data (AR7), creates a complex content mosaic. A 'standard' layout would fail to distinguish these disparate sources, creating confusion and undermining the core charter of 'rigorous respect for ground truth'. Therefore, a hybrid design incorporating elements from 'textbook' (for data and structure), 'reference' (for cross-linking and verification), and 'oral_history' (for presenting perspectives) is necessary to ensure clarity, transparency, and scholarly utility.

focus_areas: Grounded LLM methodologies in scientific publishing
Synthesizing diverse perspectives on climate data
Transparency and attribution models in hybrid human-AI authorship
